instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing backlight
threads.message:
im working on a liquid damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that after UC powers on and boots into os but with no backlight. liquid damage was around <CHIP>U9701</CHIP> i replaced the chip but noticed that there was a missing pad on ball 5 ( <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT_FB</SIGNAL>). i went to run a wire to the chip but cant seem to find wx9720 to run it to.  im thinking the boardview is not correct as it says this chip is located under <CAPACITOR>C9797</CAPACITOR>.

can anyone verify the location of this WX9720?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing backlight
threads.message: It is inside the board. Run the wire to the diode, I don't think there is a closer point.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing backlight
threads.message: ok thanks. ill give that a try.
